Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.host.system.system

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import re

from havoc.autoval.lib.host.system.system_abstract import SystemAbstract
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.openbmc import OpenBMC
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.system.bios.system_bios import SystemBios
from havoc.lib.decorators import retry


[docs]class System(SystemAbstract):

[docs]    def __init__(self, host):
        super(System, self).__init__(host)
        self.host = host
        self.bios = SystemBios(host)
        self.bmc = OpenBMC


    def __getattr__(self, name):
        return getattr(self.connection, name)


[docs]    def convert_string_matches_to_int(self, match):
        if match:
            return(int(match))
        else:
            return 0



[docs]    def get_oem_boot_sequence(self):
        seq = self.host.run("ipmitool raw 0x30 0x53")
        boot_seq = seq.split()
        return boot_seq



[docs]    @retry(
        tries=40,
        sleep_seconds=30
    )
    def get_system_boot_time(self):
        output = self.host.run("systemd-analyze")
        m = re.match(
            r'.*\+\s*((\d+)?min\s*)?((\d+)\.\d+s\s*)?(\d+ms\s*)?\(userspace\)'
            r'\s*=\s*((\d+)?min\s*)?((\d+)\.\d+s\s*)?(\d+ms\s*)?',
            output
        )
        userspace_secs = self.convert_string_matches_to_int(m.group(2)) * 60
        userspace_secs += self.convert_string_matches_to_int(m.group(4))
        total_secs = self.convert_string_matches_to_int(m.group(7)) * 60
        total_secs += self.convert_string_matches_to_int(m.group(9))
        total_boot_time = total_secs - userspace_secs
        return total_boot_time



[docs]    def get_default_csr_port(self):
        '''
        This will return all root ports, nvme memory ports and
        ethernet controller ports
        '''
        return ["2066", "2058", "root port"]



[docs]    def create_lspci_info_dump(self, lspci_dump_path, csr_ports=None):
        '''
        This will create a lspci hexadecimal dump for the given ports
        user can either pass it or by default based on the platform
        we take the ports that have nvme/ethernet/processor attached
        '''
        if not csr_ports:
            csr_ports = self.get_default_csr_port()
        cmd = "lspci | grep -i"
        for port in csr_ports:
            cmd += " -e '%s'" % port
        output = self.host.run(cmd)

        for port_info in output.splitlines():
            port = port_info.split()[0]
            cmd = 'lspci -s %s -xxxx >> %s''' % (port, lspci_dump_path)
            self.host.run(cmd)
